Misfortune's Curse.name: Misfortune's Curse
Misfortune's Curse.fullText:
Fortune Blessed Attack 11Misfortune's Curse

You steal a bit of luck from your enemy to leave the foe fumbling and stumbling through the fight.

Encounter        Divine
Immediate Reaction      Melee touch

Trigger: An enemy adjacent to you misses you with a melee attack

Target: One creature

Effect: The triggering enemy repeats the attack against a legal target of your choice or itself, with a +2 bonus to the attack roll. If the attack hits and deals damage, it deals extra damage equal to your highest ability modifier. In addition, if have 0 luck tokens when you use this power, you gain 1 luck token.


Published in Dragon Magazine 384, page(s) 71.
Misfortune's Curse.flavor: You steal a bit of luck from your enemy to leave the foe fumbling and stumbling through the fight.
Misfortune's Curse.trigger: An enemy adjacent to you misses you with a melee attack
Misfortune's Curse.effect: The triggering enemy repeats the attack against a legal target of your choice or itself, with a +2 bonus to the attack roll. If the attack hits and deals damage, it deals extra damage equal to your highest ability modifier. In addition, if have 0 luck tokens when you use this power, you gain 1 luck token.

Avandra's Curse.name: Avandra's Curse
Avandra's Curse.fullText:
Fortune Blessed Attack 20Avandra's Curse

You call to Avandra and ask the goddess to lift her gaze from your enemy. For a time, nothing goes right for your chosen foe.

Daily        Divine, Implement, Psychic
Standard Action      Ranged 10

Target: One creature

Attack: Highest ability vs. Will

Hit: 2d8 + highest ability modifier psychic damage.

Effect: The target is dazed, slowed, takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls, and takes psychic damage equal to your highest ability modifier the first time it misses with an attack on its turn (save ends all). Whenever the target succeeds on a saving throw to end the effect, you can spend 1 luck token as an immediate interrupt to force the target to reroll the saving throw and use the second result.


Published in Dragon Magazine 384, page(s) 71.
Avandra's Curse.flavor: You call to Avandra and ask the goddess to lift her gaze from your enemy. For a time, nothing goes right for your chosen foe.
Avandra's Curse.effect: The target is dazed, slowed, takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls, and takes psychic damage equal to your highest ability modifier the first time it misses with an attack on its turn (save ends all). Whenever the target succeeds on a saving throw to end the effect, you can spend 1 luck token as an immediate interrupt to force the target to reroll the saving throw and use the second result.

Lucky Break.name: Lucky Break
Lucky Break.fullText:
Fortune Blessed Utility 12Lucky Break

Unexpected fortune turns a certain injury or even death into a close call.

Daily        Divine
Immediate Interrupt      Personal

Trigger: You take damage

Effect: Reduce the triggering damage by your healing surge value. You can spend 1 luck token to add 1d20 to this amount. If this reduces the damage to 0, you also shift 1 square.


Published in Dragon Magazine 384, page(s) 71.
Lucky Break.flavor: Unexpected fortune turns a certain injury or even death into a close call.
Lucky Break.effect: Reduce the triggering damage by your healing surge value. You can spend 1 luck token to add 1d20 to this amount. If this reduces the damage to 0, you also shift 1 square.
